events.originalText: A U.S. Army Reserve veteran ambushed and shot at police officers (memorial service pictured) in Dallas, Texas, killing five of them and injuring nine others, before being killed by a bomb attached to a police robot.
events.subtitle: United States Army Reserve
events.headline: U.S. Army Reserve veteran kills five police officers in Dallas ambush

events.originalText: Yugoslav Wars: The signing of the Brioni Agreement ended the Ten-Day War between SFR Yugoslavia and Slovenia.
events.subtitle: Yugoslav Wars
events.headline: Brioni Agreement ends Ten-Day War between SFR Yugoslavia and Slovenia

events.originalText: After writing a letter to Soviet premier Yuri Andropov, American schoolgirl Samantha Smith (pictured) visited the Soviet Union as Andropov's personal guest, becoming known as "America's Youngest Ambassador".
events.subtitle: Yuri Andropov
events.headline: American schoolgirl Samantha Smith visits Soviet Union as Andropov's guest

events.originalText: The secret police of Ngô Đình Nhu, brother and chief political adviser of South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm, attacked a group of American journalists who were covering a protest during the Buddhist crisis.
events.subtitle: Ngô Đình Nhu
events.headline: Ngô Đình Nhu's secret police attack American journalists during Buddhist crisis

events.originalText: The Peel Commission published a report stating that the League of Nations' Mandate for Palestine had become unworkable and recommended the partition of British-administered Mandatory Palestine into two states.
events.subtitle: Peel Commission
events.headline: Peel Commission recommends partition of British-administered Mandatory Palestine

events.originalText: Four countries signed the North Pacific Fur Seal Convention, which banned the hunting of seals in the pelagic zone.
events.subtitle: North Pacific Fur Seal Convention of 1911
events.headline: North Pacific Fur Seal Convention signed, banning seal hunting in pelagic zone

events.originalText: Inspired by the Folies Bergère of Paris, American impresario Florenz Ziegfeld Jr. staged the first of his Ziegfeld Follies.
events.subtitle: Folies Bergère
events.headline: Florenz Ziegfeld Jr. stages first Ziegfeld Follies inspired by Folies Bergère

events.originalText: Outraged by the XYZ Affair, the United States rescinded its treaties with France, resulting in the undeclared Quasi-War, fought entirely at sea.
events.subtitle: XYZ Affair
events.headline: United States rescinds treaties with France over XYZ Affair, leading to Quasi-War

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces caught up with American troops withdrawing from Ticonderoga, capturing more than 200 men at the Battle of Hubbardton.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces capture over 200 American troops at Battle of Hubbardton

events.originalText: A dispute between Sir John Forster and Sir John Carmichael led to a Scottish raid on Northumberland, England, in which 27 men were killed.
events.subtitle: John Forster (soldier)
events.headline: Scottish raid on Northumberland results in 27 deaths after dispute between Sirs Forster and Carmichael

events.originalText: Joan of Arc was declared innocent of heresy in a retrial twenty-five years after her death.
events.subtitle: Joan of Arc
events.headline: Joan of Arc declared innocent of heresy in retrial twenty-five years after death
